PERSONA:
meet david, a 72-year-old retired university professor living in the san francisco bay area. as a lifelong democrat and self-described "very liberal," david is actively engaged in his community, often volunteering for local environmental causes and attending city council meetings to advocate for social justice. he holds a ph.d. in sociology from the university of california, berkeley, and has a deep understanding of the complexities of social inequality.

david was born and raised in the united states, specifically in the pacific northwest, but has called the bay area home for over 40 years. he identifies as white and non-hispanic, and his jewish faith plays an important role in his life, although he only attends synagogue a few times a year.

after a long and fulfilling career in academia, david is now divorced and living alone in a cozy condominium in oakland. despite his busy schedule, he makes time to stay connected with his two adult children and four grandchildren, who live in the area.

david is an avid user of the internet, often spending hours reading news articles, browsing social media, and staying up-to-date on current events. he is frustrated by the current state of politics and is eager to see change, which motivates him to participate in local activism and advocacy efforts.

as a registered voter, david exercises his right to vote in every election, and he encourages his friends and family to do the same. despite his strong convictions, david is open to hearing opposing viewpoints and engaging in respectful dialogue, a trait that serves him well in his volunteer work and community engagement.

david's annual family income is substantial, although he prefers not to disclose the exact amount. he is grateful for his financial security, which allows him to pursue his passions and support causes he cares about.
